answers.answer: Individuals traveling from Ukraine to Romania can receive fast, free, and safe transportation services, along with free medical care, water, and food if needed.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/buses-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: People travel through Moldova via daily buses that depart from the Palanca border in Moldova to Huși in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/buses-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The UN Refugee Agency (UNHCR) and the International Organization for Migration (IOM) assist with transit between Ukraine and Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/buses-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Anyone fleeing the war in Ukraine qualifies for free transportation services, regardless of their nationality.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/buses-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The transportation services for crossing from Ukraine into Romania via Moldova are free of cost.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/buses-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Transportation services originate from the Ukrainian-Moldovan border, with daily buses departing specifically from the Palanca border in Moldova.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/buses-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The initial destination in Romania is the city of Huși, from where individuals can take free buses to Bucharest or Iasi.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/buses-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The journey from the Palanca border in Moldova to Huși in Romania typically takes 5-6 hours.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/buses-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: During the transit process, fast, free, and safe transportation is provided, and upon reaching Huși, free medical care, water, and food are available if required.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/buses-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The Romanian and Moldavian governments are involved to organize safe and free transportation for all people fleeing the war in Ukraine.

answers.answer: The journey utilizes the Ukrainian-Moldovan border and the Palanca border in Moldova, leading to the Romanian border.

answers.answer: Travelers can arrange onward journeys by taking free buses from Huși to Bucharest or Iasi.
